revised_title: Anniversary Address: Scientific Collaboration and Research in Post-War Era
tldr: In his 1944 Anniversary Address, Sir Henry Dale discusses the importance of scientific collaboration and research in the post-war era. He highlights the successful mission of Professor A. V. Hill to India and the growing collaboration between Indian and British scientists. He also mentions the establishment of special committees to advise on the needs of fundamental research in various scientific disciplines. The address emphasizes the Royal Society's commitment to promoting the advancement of knowledge and its role in supporting research at the frontiers of the unknown.
